Global

Members

ShapeType

ShapeType is used in shape creation through the Shape() constructor to direct which shape type the Shape() should identify itself by. The number values inside this are not meant to be used as constants, but as an enum for easier identification.
Source:
  • lang.js, line 182

System

The global System variable stores all of the objects or variables closely tied to the base OS. Objects such as Windows are stored here, and can also be created using its constructor. Anything that is not directly used in the System or OS environment is not stored here, like the Graphics or Component objects. Just because they are used in an object associated with System does not mean that it is a part of the System object.
Source:
  • lang.js, line 8

Methods

Line(x1, y1, x2, y2)

Line() is a "subclass" of shape. This is primarily meant to be a class to make it easier to create specific shapes like lines, in this case. Inside the constructor, the ShapeType.LINE is automatically inserted into the internal shape object.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
x1 int The starting x coordinate of the line
y1 int The starting y coordinate of the line
x2 int The ending x coordinate of the line
y2 int The ending y coordinate of the line
Source:
  • lang.js, line 197

Text(text, x, y, data)

Text() is a "subclass" similar to that of Line(). It is used to make creating ShapeType.TEXT Shapes easier and more straight foward. The internal Shape() object stored in the Text() object is initialized with ShapeType.TEXT as its shape type.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
text string The text that is displayed on a Graphics() object if Shape() is added to Graphics()
x int The x coordinate of the text
y int The y coordinate of the text
data object A JSON object containing things like TextBaseline and TextAlign
Source:
  • lang.js, line 211
